definition: lit. to ride the wind and crest the waves/to be ambitious and unafraid (idiom)
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: Winds and waves stop sometimes, hoisting the sails to travel in the vast sea.
sentences.chinese: 長風破浪終有時，直掛雲帆濟滄海。

sentences.english: The long breeze ride the waves a meeting sometimes, hangs cloud sail benefit sea.
sentences.chinese: 長風破浪會有時，只掛雲帆濟滄海。
